intro: Ebenus myrmecocalyx, commonly known as the ant-mimic plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its unique leaf morphology that resembles ant colonies. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its distinctive appearance and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
